info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 8:24AM CDT until June 15 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Cooke and Montague.
* WHEN...Until 1130 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are forecast. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gainesville, Bowie, Nocona, Muenster, St. Jo, Lindsay, Callisburg, Lake Muenster, Hubert H Moss Lake, Lake Nocona, Sunset, Lake Amon G Carter, Lake Kiowa, Ray Roberts Park Johnson Branch, Lake Texoma, Road Runner, Valley View, Nocona Hills, Montague and Oak Ridge.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM CDT THIS MORNING
